author: Special Correspondent
text:
Cattle-rearers expect the Animal Husbandry Department to conduct the exhibition of Bargur cattle without delay this year.

The exhibition of the unique breed of cattle was started during 2014.

The first exhibition was conducted during the second week of February in 2014.

Last year, it was first planned for conduct during the last week of March and then postponed by a month.

This time, there is an apprehension on two counts. Sanction of funds for the purpose, in the aftermath of the floods, and the impending elections to the Assembly.

Farmers, on their part, have already started grooming their cattle for the annual event, buoyed by increase in reward.

The prize-money was doubled last year.

The first prize winner for the best breeder received Rs. 20,000. Likewise, the second and third prize winners received Rs. 10,000 and Rs. 5,000 respectively. There were two first prizes, four second prizes, and eight third prizes.

Altogether, there were 13 prizes for cows and same number of prizes for oxen.

Meanwhile, the proposed Bargur Cattle Research Station on the hills is taking shape.

Fifty acres have been levelled and the start of construction is likely within a month, sources said.

The Tamil Nadu Veterinary and Animal Sciences University has completed the process of finalising the locations for construction of buildings on the site, it is learnt.
title: Bargur cattle rearers await timely conduct of exhibition
